articles.author: Ron Bousso
articles.description: Shell (SHEL.L) will cut around 15% of its low-carbon division workforce and scale back its hydrogen business as part of CEO Wael Sawan's drive to boost profits, the company told Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Shell cuts low carbon jobs, scales back hydrogen in CEO overhaul -sources

articles.author: Carolina Mandl
articles.description: Hedge funds have been buying consumer staple stocks in Europe in October while dumping the sector in the U.S., driven by concerns about the impact of weight-loss drugs on food habits, Goldman Sachs showed in two different reports about trading flows.
articles.title: Weight-loss drugs driving hedge fund consumer stock flows -Goldman Sachs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An artificial intelligence safety forum launched by companies including OpenAI, Microsoft and Google named its first director on Wednesday, and said it would create an advisory board in the coming months to help guide its strategy.
articles.title: Microsoft, OpenAI-backed AI safety forum names first director, plans advisory board

articles.author: Gilles Guillaume, Giulio Piovaccari
articles.description: Stellantis NV (STLAM.MI) is nearing a deal to acquire a stake in electric vehicle company Zhejiang Leapmotor <9863.HK>, a source close to the matter said on Wednesday, and the car maker said it would give an important update on Thursday.
articles.title: Stellantis nears deal to buy stake in Chinese EV maker Leapmotor -source

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Consumer Reports on Wednesday said it has found "concerning" levels of lead and cadmium in a new array of chocolate products, and renewed its call for Hershey (HSY.N) to reduce the amounts of heavy metals its chocolate contains.
articles.title: Consumer Reports finds more lead, cadmium in chocolate, urges change at Hershey

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The interest rate on the most popular U.S. home loan last week jumped to the highest since September 2000, marking its seventh straight weekly increase and driving mortgage applications to a 28-year low, a survey showed on Wednesday.
articles.title: U.S mortgage rates soar to highest in more than 23 years

articles.author: Lananh Nguyen, Lawrence White
articles.description: Barclays Plc (BARC.L) is laying off dozens of staff in its U.S. consumer banking division as part of a global drive to cut costs, according to a source familiar with the situation.
articles.title: Exclusive: Barclays to lay off dozens of US consumer employees - source

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: With so many bodies, Palestinians in Gaza are burying the unidentified dead in mass graves, with a number instead of a name, residents say. Now some families are using bracelets in the hope of finding their loved ones should they be killed.
articles.title: Gaza families wear ID bracelets to avoid burial in mass graves

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi
articles.description: Andrii Ilkiv, a Ukrainian police sapper, had his leg amputated below the knee after a land mine blew up beneath him in September 2022.
articles.title: Despite losing limbs, Ukrainian sappers return to work clearing land mines

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: FedEx Corp (FDX.N) on Wednesday said its U.S. Express deliveries could be delayed due to an overnight Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) information technology system outage.
articles.title: FedEx says U.S. Express service disrupted, blames FAA IT outage overnight
